title: Latest News from Science Magazine
description: Keyword search result for Alerts: News Weekly Headlines -- New results matching your keyword search query (updated daily).

items.title: ‘A sigh of relief’: New malaria drug succeeds in large clinical trial
items.description: As existing drugs falter because of resistance, the world gets a backup—but hard choices loom on how to use it

items.title: Fossil vomit contains new species of pterosaur from Brazil
items.description: Filter-feeding flying reptile was likely devoured by a dinosaur during the early Cretaceous

items.title: Astronomers detect first eruption of plasma around a star other than the Sun
items.description: Coronal mass ejections would make it hard for planets to keep an atmosphere and host life

items.title: After Coalition S disrupted scientific publishing, new plan retreats from strict requirements
items.description: The group’s latest strategy emphasizes consultation, lacks spending pledges

items.title: Australia’s unprecedented toxic algal bloom has a surprise culprit
items.description: A relatively unknown species is producing a notorious neurotoxin, devastating sea life

items.title: New, more stable qubits could simplify dreamed-of quantum computers
items.description: Advance underscores the importance of materials science for quantum computing

items.title: That’s no spider! It’s a decoy
items.description: Arachnids build large lookalikes to ward off predators

items.title: Canadian government kills ostriches afflicted by H5N1 despite appeal from RFK Jr.
items.description: Culling proceeds after Canada’s Supreme Court ends heated 11-month battle over the fate of more than 300 birds

items.title: Sand mining threatens Asia’s largest lake
items.description: Cambodia’s Tonlé Sap supports important fisheries and wildlife

items.title: The twisted secret behind a chameleon’s oddball eyes
items.description: Coiled nerves allow the reptiles to move their peepers in multiple directions at once without moving their heads
